@graph.name: Lentil Veggie Asparagus Frittata Recipe
@graph.description: Lentil Veggie Asparagus Frittata. Blended red lentils make the egg in this lentil frittata filled with Spring vegetables. Easy Vegan Gluten-free Soy-free Recipe. Makes 1 8 or 9 inch pie or cake pan.

video.name: Vegan Lentil Veggie Frittata Soyfree - VeganRicha.com
video.description:
Blended Red Lentils make the "egg" in this lentil frittata filled with Spring vegetables. Lentil Veggie Asparagus Frittata.
Easy Vegan Gluten-free Soy-free Recipe. No Tofu, No Chickpeas!

Recipe :-- http://www.veganricha.com/2016/03/lentil-veggie-asparagus-frittata.html


****************************************­*******
Connect with me!

Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/VeganRicha

Instagram: http://instagram.com/veganricha

Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/veganricha

My blog: http://veganricha.com

My cookbook: Vegan Richa's Indian kitchen http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/1941252095/vegric-20


****************************************­*******

recipeIngredient: 1/2 cup red lentils (masoor dal, split red lentils, or use Moong Dal )
1 tbsp flax seed meal or chia seed meal
2 tsp starch like cornstarch or arrowroot starch
1/4 tsp turmeric for color (1/8 tsp or more Indian kala namak (Indian sulphur salt) - for the eggy taste (optional))
1/3 tsp each of garlic powder, chipotle pepper powder and garam masala (or use other spice blend and cayenne)
1  loaded cup asparagus (chopped into 1 inch size bites)
2 cups chopped veggies. I use a cup cauliflower (small florets, 1/2 cup chopped carrots and some red bell pepper, peas, mushrooms etc.)
1/2 cup packed baby spinach (I used spinach + celery leaves + 1/4 cup chopped cilantro)
1/3 tsp chipotle pepper powder (a dash of black pepper)

recipeInstructions.text: Soak the lentils in hot water for at least 20 minutes. Soak them before you get the ingredients together as the rest of the steps will take about that much time. Prepare your pan by lining with parchment or greasing well. Preheat the oven to 365 degrees F / 180ºc
recipeInstructions.name: Soak the lentils in hot water for at least 20 minutes. Soak them before you get the ingredients together as the rest of the steps will take about that much time. Prepare your pan by lining with parchment or greasing well. Preheat the oven to 365 degrees F / 180ºc

itemListElement.text: Chop up the veggies and keep aside. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add onions, garlic and cook until onions are translucent. 3-4 mins.
itemListElement.name: Chop up the veggies and keep aside. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add onions, garlic and cook until onions are translucent. 3-4 mins.

itemListElement.text: Add the asparagus, cauliflower, carrots and other veggies if using and mix in. Cover and cook for 2 minutes. Add in the spices, greens and mix in. Cover and cook for 2 to 4 minutes or until the greens are wilted. Take off heat and Let it sit covered for another minute.
itemListElement.name: Add the asparagus, cauliflower, carrots and other veggies if using and mix in. Cover and cook for 2 minutes. Add in the spices, greens and mix in. Cover and cook for 2 to 4 minutes or until the greens are wilted. Take off heat and Let it sit covered for another minute.

itemListElement.text: Drain the lentils and blend with 1 cup water. Blend for atleast a minute. Add the almond flour and the rest of the ingredients and blend until smooth. I blended 2 full 50 second cycles in the blendtec.
itemListElement.name: Drain the lentils and blend with 1 cup water. Blend for atleast a minute. Add the almond flour and the rest of the ingredients and blend until smooth. I blended 2 full 50 second cycles in the blendtec.

itemListElement.text: Transfer the veggies to the parchment lined pan. Mix in vegan cheese shreds if using.
itemListElement.name: Transfer the veggies to the parchment lined pan. Mix in vegan cheese shreds if using.

itemListElement.text: Drizzle the lentil mixture on the veggies and spread with a spatula. Tap once or twice so the mixture settles on the veggies.
itemListElement.name: Drizzle the lentil mixture on the veggies and spread with a spatula. Tap once or twice so the mixture settles on the veggies.

itemListElement.text: Bake for 40 to 50 minutes until a tooth pick from the center comes out almost clean and not wet.
itemListElement.name: Bake for 40 to 50 minutes until a tooth pick from the center comes out almost clean and not wet.

itemListElement.text: Cool in the pan for 10 mintues, Then cool on the cooling rack for another 5-10 before slicing. Serve with avocado and sriracha or other sauce, chutney or dressing.
itemListElement.name: Cool in the pan for 10 mintues, Then cool on the cooling rack for another 5-10 before slicing. Serve with avocado and sriracha or other sauce, chutney or dressing.
